content: rosebud materials gauge 3 skeins koigu kpppm 1 not important skein each color #1110 stitch patterns 2409 & 2400 double_crochet size d 3 25mm crochet hook skill level needle nosed pliers 1/9 jump rings tapestry needle all information and images contained in this pattern are © john brinegar and may not be reproduced or used one size fits most without explicit written permission this scarf is composed of granny squares all made the same way varying color combinations no square is alike it is assumed you know how to crochet and make a basic granny square consult granny square instructions first if necessary the following is a list of color combinations you will make one of each square the colors are simply listed the squares are made with a center and three subsequent one whole black square 37 one whole red square 38 one whole gray square once all squares are made connect them with jump rings using needle nose pliers there is no specific order to assembling the squares i just attached them however i thought they would look nice the connections are at each corner and sides the two rings connecting the center of the squares are interlocked weave in ends and block to measurements tips ∙ attach the jump rings over a couple sittings your hands will really hurt if you try to do them all at once larger rings will attach easier but the size of the squares look better with the 1/9 rings ∙ trap old color when changing to a new color by doing the first corner s worth of double crochets on top of the old color tail and new color tail thereby weaving them in simultaneously you do not want to weave in all the ends of this scarf once the scarf is done simply cut the ends off
